intro: Syngonanthus niveus var. rosulatus, commonly known as the silverleaf snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale blue flowers. The plant features succulent, silver-gray leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ornamental value comes from its elegant appearance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
